sentences.en: "Prices are down 40 per cent since Christmas," he lamented.
sentences.cn: “圣诞节以来物价降了4成，”他悲叹道。

sentences.en: 20 to 40 per cent of the voters are undecided.
A cup of rice which cost thirty cents a few weeks ago is now being sold for up to one dollar.
sentences.cn: 几周前价值30美分的1杯米如今卖到了1美元。

sentences.en: Bank base rates of 7 per cent are too high.
Costs have been cut by 30 to 50 per cent.
Defence soaks up forty per cent of the budget.
He claims a 70 to 80 per cent success rate.
sentences.cn: 他声称成功率有七到八成。

sentences.en: In general, incumbents have a 94 per cent chance of being reelected.
sentences.cn: 通常现任官员有94%的几率会再次当选。

sentences.en: It's 50 per cent wool, 50 per cent acrylic.
sentences.cn: 它含50%的羊毛、50%的丙烯酸纤维。

sentences.en: Most restaurants add a 10 per cent service charge.
sentences.cn: 大多数餐馆加收10％的服务费。

sentences.en: Ninety per cent of lone parent families are headed by mothers.
Ninety-nine per cent of primary pupils now have hands-on experience of computers.
sentences.cn: 现在，99%的小学生都亲手操作过电脑。

sentences.en: The bank yesterday revealed a 30 per cent nosedive in profits.
sentences.cn: 该银行昨天透露其利润骤降30％。

sentences.en: The economy needs an immediate 2 per cent cut in interest rates.
sentences.cn: 当前经济状况需要立即将利率下调两个百分点.

sentences.en: The Gulf has 65 per cent of the world's oil reserves.
sentences.cn: 海湾地区拥有全世界65％的石油储藏。

sentences.en: Today's RPI figure shows inflation running at 10.9 per cent.
sentences.cn: 今天的零售物价指数显示通货膨胀率为10.9％。

words.tran_cn: 集中，使聚集在一点；定中心
分；一分的硬币；森特（等于半音程的百分之一）

trans.tran_cn: 分（美元、欧元等的货币单位）
trans.tran_en: 1/100th of the standard unit of money in some countries. For example, there are 100 cents in one dollar or in one  euro  : symbol ¢.
